recipe.name: Lyra's Dad's Chilli

ingredients.name: Core Ingredients
entries: Neutral flavour cooking oil, like sunflower or vegetable

entries.entry: {=amount1/c} {@unit {=amount1}|can|cans} of beans in spicy tomato sauce

items.name: Suggested Bean Types
items.entry: Red Kidney, Black, Black Eyed, Pinto, Adzuki

entries.entry: {=amount1/v} red bell or cubanelle peppers, diced
{=amount1}g smoked pancetta cubes, or diced smoked bacon rashers
{=amount1/v} poblano or ancho chillies with seeds, finely diced
{=amount1/c} {@link packets of chilli mix|https://www.tesco.com/groceries/en-GB/products/254882706}, avoid tomato based packets

entries: A large squirt of liquid smoke
Sugar to taste, demerara preferred

ingredients.name: To Serve
entries: A bunch of sliced spring onions (scallions)
Guacamole
Sour cream
Mild cheese, freshly grated

equipment: A large cast iron casserole dish.

instructions.name: First Steps
entries: This will take a moment, so do this first and then prep the rest of the ingredients while the onions brown.
Add a splash of neutral oil to a large frying pan and add the pancetta or bacon. Once the fat has started to be released, add the diced onions and allow to brown.
The onions will take a minimum of 20 minutes to brown to a juicy caramelised state; you can add some unrefined demerara sugar to help speed this up.

instructions.name: Pepper Prep
entries: {@note Optionally you can blister the peppers before adding them. If you want to do this, you should dice them {@b after} blistering them.}
{@note Halve the peppers and remove the cores, roast them cut side down on a baking sheet covered with parchment for 25 minutes in an oven at 220°C (200°C fan assisted), then dice.}

instructions.name: Lost in the Sauce
entries: Drain and rinse the assorted cans of beans in a colander. Do not drain the beans in spicy sauce.
In a large casserole combine the beans, the Liquid Smoke, the BBQ Sauce, the chillies, the Bovril, the cocoa powder, and the carrots and the mushrooms if using.
Add the packets of chilli mix and the mild chilli powder. If any of the packets have a high starch content (e.g. primarily corn starch) then keep those packets back for now.
Thoroughly mix the cool ingredients.

instructions.name: Heating Up
entries: Add the diced peppers to the casserole. If using the half tin of tomatoes add them to the casserole as well.
Once the onions and pancetta have finished browning use a slotted spoon to transfer them to the casserole, leaving the rendered fat and oil in the pan.
Mix the peppers, onions and pancetta into the sauce and place the casserole into the oven on a low heat to start to warm up.
Add another splash of oil to the frying pan.
Break the mince up by hand and add it to the frying pan until it just covers the base. Brown the mince in batches and transfer into the casserole.
If there are any high-starch packet mixes left, make up a slurry with boiling water and add it to the casserole.

instructions.name: Chill Out
entries: Cook the chilli on the hob for a short while and stir well.
Add some water to the chilli but don't use a lid. It's far better to end up with a chilli with too much liquid than a chilli that dried out.
Put the casserole in the oven at 150°C for one hour and use this opportunity to clean up.
Halfway through the cooking time stir the chilli and scrape down any that has splashed up the sides of the casserole.
Take the chilli out of the oven and leave to cool overnight which will give the flavours time to mellow and develop.
The next day, bag the chilli for freezing for up to 9 months. A typical portion size is about 350g.

instructions.name: Serve
entries: Heat tortilla wraps in the oven briefly and freshly grate cheese over the chilli to taste.
Serve with sour cream and your preferred style of guacamole, garnish with sliced spring onions.

noteCook: Don't add any garlic, olive oil, or too much tomato. Those are Italian flavours that will make your chilli start to taste like Bolognese.
Whenever the recipe calls for an ingredient to be diced, each cube should be no larger than an individual bean.
Mushrooms and carrots are atypical ingredients in chilli. They're included here to bulk it out if you're on a budget.
Don't substitute the cocoa powder for drinking chocolate which contains milk powder.

recipeFluff.name: Lyra's Dad's Chilli
entries: Everyone has their own take on certain dishes, and chilli is a fairly divisive one.
If you already have your own recipe then I look forward to giving it a try. I'd urge you to do the same for this one.
